intro: Rhagodia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved rhagodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and coastal areas. Rhagodia crassifolia is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its thick, water-storing leaves.
